com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface getSalesOrderDetails

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi
    Deprecated. 
    Replaced by the getCompleteOrderDetails COM PCA API as of Sterling Multi-Channel Fulfillment Solution 8.0.

    public interface getSalesOrderDetails

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getSalesOrderDetails(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      Deprecated. 
      The getSalesOrderDetails API returns detailed information about a specific order.

    • Method Detail

      • getSalesOrderDetails

        org.w3c.dom.Document getSalesOrderDetails(YFSEnvironment env,
                                          org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                   throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                          java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        The getSalesOrderDetails API returns detailed information about a specific order. In addition to the information returned by the getOrderDetails API, getSalesOrderDetails can also return information about shipments, containers, return orders and exchange orders associated with the order.
        While the getSalesOrderDetails API may be invoked on any order document type, is recommended for use with sales order document types. The information returned, such as associated return orders and shipment information, are most logical for a sales order document.
        Additionally, the getSalesOrderDetails API can be used to return only a few order lines at a time. These can be based on a maximum number of order lines to return, or the user can specify the exact order lines to appear in the output. When run with a subset of the order's lines, the getSalesOrderDetails API will only return work order, shipment, container, return order and exchange order information specific to the order lines being returned.
        If the getSalesOrderDetails API is called on a return Order it will appear as the main order and the return element will be empty if present. Similarly if called on an exchangeOrder the information for the original order and for the return which is being exchanged will be ommitted by this API.
        Because an order can have a shipment that includes multiple lines, the information on the shipment is returned at the order header level, with only identifying information appearing under each order line to indicate what shipments, if any, that line is included in. The same is true for shipment containers, work orders, and return orders.
        If the getSalesOrderDetails API is invoked with the SortingType attribute set to ITEM, order lines are sorted based on item id in ascending order. If order lines have relationship then it returns related lines below parent line and sorts related lines by item id within a relationship type. If the getSalesOrderDetails API is invoked for a subset of order lines and if this set does not contain the parent order line then it will sort the order lines only based on item id.
        The getSalesOrderDetails API can also return an OverallStatus attribute for orders and order lines. This attribute's value is based on the user exit YFSGetOverallStatusUE. See the "User Exits" section for more information.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetOverallStatusUE
            This user exit is called if any element in the output template has the OverallStatus attribute. It is invoked for each order if that order's template element or that order's order line template element contains the OverallStatus attribute.
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSConvertCurrencyUE
            This user exit is called only if the Output Template has any of the following elements below
            • LineOverallTotalsInEnterpriseCurrency
            • LineRemainingTotalsInEnterpriseCurrency
            • OverallTotalsInEnterpriseCurrency
            • PriceInfoInEnterpriseCurrency
            • RemainingTotalsInEnterpriseCurrency

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetFundsAvailableUE
            When all of the conditions below are met, this user exit is called for each payment method whose payment type has ChargeUpToAvailable set to Y
            • The Input has the GetFundsAvailable flag set to Y
            • The Output template contains the FundsAvailable attribute at the PaymentMethod element
          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemDetailsUE
            This user exit is called only if the output template has ItemDetails element under OrderLine element.

          Events Raised: None

          Audits: None

          Pre-conditions: None

          Post-conditions: None

          Output Template Support:
          Yes. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to output xml for element level details.

          Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. Contains attributes of the order for which details must be returned. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details of the order. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
